revised_title: The Electro-Magnetic Clock: A Revolutionary Timekeeping Device
tldr: In this paper, Charles Wheatstone describes the electro-magnetic clock, a revolutionary timekeeping device that can accurately indicate the same time in multiple distant locations. The clock relies on an electro-magnet and a constant voltaic battery to create and break the circuit periodically, enabling synchronization with other electro-magnetic instruments. Wheatstone also discusses alternative methods, such as using Faraday's magneto-electric currents, and modifications to improve the device's performance at greater distances.
